hanzi-su-wiki:
採

Значения

Брать, отбирать; добывать

Мнемоника

Щепотью 爫 руки 扌 собирать с дерева 木 плоды или листья.

Варианты

采
purpleculture_pinyin:
cǎi
to pick; to pluck; to collect; to select; to choose; to gather
подобрать; ощипывать; собирать; выбирать; выбирать; собирать
rtega_mnemonic:
採採RSgather, collect, pick, select
  • gathering 采 things by hand 扌
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 采)
Pictophonetic: 采 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
採取 [ cǎi qǔ ]: to adopt or carry out (measures, policies, course of action); to take
採用 [ cǎi yòng ]: to adopt; to employ; to use
採訪 [ cǎi fǎng ]: to interview; to gather news; to hunt for and collect; to cover
採購 [ cǎi gòu ]: to procure (for an enterprise etc); to purchase
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 采 [ cǎi ] to collect, to gather; to pick, to pluck
heisig_chinese_memo: You pick cherries with your fingers, then along comes a giant vulture and picks up the whole tree with its claws.
heisig_constituent: pick, finger, fingers, grab, claw, vulture, tree, wood
heisig_story: Unlike pick up (Frame 720), this character is used for picking fruits from trees. Its elements: finger . . . grab.
koohiiStory1: You pick cheries with your fingers, then along comes a giant vulture and picks up the whole tree with its claws.
koohiiStory2: Tip: vulture + tree : Heisig later combines these into a single kanji 采 called grab (#2090). Story: As you go to pick your nose, your parent grabs your finger and pulls it away (& gives you a lecture on social etiquette). REF: "grab" also appears in vegetable (#734), coloring (#1714).
jp_example_words:
採掘(さいくつ): mining
採決(さいけつ): vote, roll call
採算(さいさん): profit
採集(さいしゅう): collecting, gathering
採択(さいたく): adoption, selection, choice
採用(さいよう): use, adopt
採点(さいてん): marking, grading, looking over
採る(とる): adopt (measure, proposal), pick (fruit), assume (attitude)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Take your fingers and dig the tree bits out of this cleat to gather it into evidence. Gather it in a pile or a bag, just make sure it's all in one place so you can take a closer look later.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture your fingers really getting in there to gather the tree pieces from out of this cleat. Some of the tree bits are stabbing under your fingernails, but you have to keep gathering them, don't stop now!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You gather them all together and realize there are cyborg (さい) parts mixed in with the tree bits. Uh oh, it's as you feared. Your cyborg definitely got into trouble somewhere around here and you walked all over it with your cleats.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Gather all of these cyborg bits so you can find it and reattach them later.
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 采 (とる、いろどり、サイ выбирать, собирать).
Ru_trainchinese: cǎi: (глаг) срывать (цветы, фрукты); выбирать, отбирать, собирать; извлекать, добывать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you roll the dice (采) with your hand (扌) to decide whether to take it on
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You pick cherries with your fingers, then along comes a giant vulture and picks up the whole tree with its claws.
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
採 (Simplified: 采)
Pinyin: cǎi
English Definition: to pick; to pluck; to collect; to select; to choose; to gather
Total strokes: 11; Radical: 手
Pictophonetic: 采 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 采 [ cǎi ] to collect, to gather; to pick, to pluck
Example Words:
採取 [ cǎi qǔ ]: to adopt or carry out (measures, policies, course of action); to take
採用 [ cǎi yòng ]: to adopt; to employ; to use
採訪 [ cǎi fǎng ]: to interview; to gather news; to hunt for and collect; to cover
採購 [ cǎi gòu ]: to procure (for an enterprise etc); to purchase
More: 採* | *採 | *採*

採採RS gather, collect, pick, select
  • gathering 采 things by hand 扌
(Simplified: 采)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 采 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 采 [ cǎi ] to collect, to gather; to pick, to pluck
①摘取：採擷。採花。採摘。採製。
②選取，蒐集，開發，利用：採訪(蒐集尋訪)。採納(接受意見)。採集。採伐。採購。採掘。採寫。
③神色，精神：神采。精采。
④同“彩”。
⑤(采采)盛多的樣子。
⑥古代指官。

採字的基本解释

採
cǎi
同“采1”①②。

採字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cǎi］
［《廣韻》倉宰切，上海，清。］
(1)砍伐；摘取。
(2)开采发掘。
(3)选取；搜集。
(4)触动，交感。
(5)捕捉。
(6)扯；揪。
(7)理睬。
(8)“埰”的讹字。参见“採清”。

採字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　採； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页438第12
【唐韻】倉宰切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】此宰切，?同采。摘也，取也，㩜也。【戰國策】芻牧薪採，莫敢闚東門。【註】大者薪，小者採。【晉書·劉琨傳】古語云：山有猛獸，藜藿爲之不採。【唐書·地理志】開元二十一年，置十五採訪使檢察，如漢刺史之職。◎按採本从爪从木，爪即手也。後人又加手作採。

採字的源字形

字源演变：

楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
採字的起名意思

暂无。

Pick
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［cǎi］
["Guangyun" Cangzaiqie, Shanghai, Qing Dynasty. ]
(1) Felling; picking.
(2) Mining and excavation.
(3) Select; collect.
(4) Touch and sympathize.
(5) Capture.
(6) Pull; pull.
(7) Pay attention to.
(8) The corrupt word of "Cai". See "Caiqing".
Pick
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Mao Collection] [Hand Character Department] 　采; Kangxi Strokes: 12; Page Number: Page 438 No. 12
[Tang Yun] Cang Zai cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun] This Zai cut,? Same pick. Pick it, take it, 㩜 also. [Warring States Policy] Humble grazing, don’t dare to see the east gate. [Note] The big one is paid, the small one is paid. [Book of Jin·Biography of Liu Kun] The old saying goes: There are beasts in the mountains, and the quinoa is unacceptable. [Book of Tang·Geography] In the 21st year of Kaiyuan, the fifteenth procuratorial agency was appointed as the post of the governor of Han Dynasty. ◎According to the book from the claw from the wood, the claw is also the hand. Later generations increased their hands.

cǎi
см. 采 (собирать; срывать)
Radicals: 扌, 木  (fingers, tree, cleat)
Meaning Mnemonic
Take your fingers and dig the tree bits out of this cleat to gather it into evidence. Gather it in a pile or a bag, just make sure it's all in one place so you can take a closer look later.
Picture your fingers really getting in there to gather the tree pieces from out of this cleat. Some of the tree bits are stabbing under your fingernails, but you have to keep gathering them, don't stop now!
Reading Mnemonic
You gather them all together and realize there are cyborg (さい) parts mixed in with the tree bits. Uh oh, it's as you feared. Your cyborg definitely got into trouble somewhere around here and you walked all over it with your cleats.
Gather all of these cyborg bits so you can find it and reattach them later.
